block.theurgy.calcination_oven.tooltip: A device to extract Alchemical Salt from Items.
block.theurgy.calcination_oven.tooltip.e: Salt represents the "body" or "physical matter" of an object.
block.theurgy.calcination_oven.tooltip.u:
Place this on top of a heating device such as a Pyromantic Brazier.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with ingredients to place them in the oven for processing.
block.theurgy.caloric_flux_emitter.toolt: Remotely heats an Apparatus by emitting Caloric Flux at it.
Caloric Flux is energy in the form of raw heat, and as such a derivative of Mercury Flux.

§aSneak-Right-Click§r§7 an apparatus block to set it as the target for the emitter.
Then place the emitter on a Mercury Flux source, such as a Mercury Catalyst.
It will "shoot" Caloric Flux at the apparatus, heating it up.
block.theurgy.deepslate_sal_ammoniac_ore: Ore that yields Sal Ammoniac Crystals for use in a Sal Ammoniac Accumulator.
block.theurgy.digestion_vat.tooltip: A vat for alchemical digestion, required for exaltation.
block.theurgy.digestion_vat.tooltip.exte: Digestion is fundamental the conversion between tiers of matter (such as between common and rare [e.g. iron and gold]).
block.theurgy.digestion_vat.tooltip.usag:
§aRight-Click§r§7 with ingredients to place them in the vat for processing.
§aShift-right-Click§r§7 with an empty hand to close or open the vat to start or stop processing.
block.theurgy.distiller.tooltip: A device to extract Alchemical Mercury from Items.
block.theurgy.distiller.tooltip.extended: Mercury represents the "energy" of an object. It has applications both as an energy source and as a catalyst.
block.theurgy.distiller.tooltip.usage:
Place this on top of a heating device such as a Pyromantic Brazier.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with ingredients to add them to the distiller for processing.
block.theurgy.fermentation_vat.tooltip: A vat for alchemical fermentation, required for transmutation.
block.theurgy.fermentation_vat.tooltip.e: Fermentation is fundamental the conversion between types of matter (such as between metals and gems).
block.theurgy.fermentation_vat.tooltip.u:
§aRight-Click§r§7 with ingredients to place them in the vat for processing.
§aShift-right-Click§r§7 with an empty hand to close or open the vat to start or stop processing.
block.theurgy.incubator.tooltip: A device to recombine Alchemical Sulfur, Salt and Mercury into items.
block.theurgy.incubator.tooltip.usage:
Place this on top of a heating device such as a Pyromantic Brazier.
Needs Incubator Vessels for all three ingredient types adjacent horizontally to the incubator.
block.theurgy.incubator_mercury_vessel.t: A vessel to hold Mercury for the Incubator.

Place horizontally next to the incubator.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with Alchemical Mercury to fill the vessel to allow the Incubator to process it.
block.theurgy.incubator_salt_vessel.tool: A vessel to hold Salt for the Incubator.

Place horizontally next to the incubator.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with Alchemical Salt to fill the vessel to allow the Incubator to process it.
block.theurgy.incubator_sulfur_vessel.to: A vessel to hold Sulfur for the Incubator.

Place horizontally next to the incubator.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with Alchemical Sulfur to fill the vessel to allow the Incubator to process it.
block.theurgy.liquefaction_cauldron.tool: A device to extract Alchemical Sulfur from Items using a Solvent.
Sulfur represents the "idea" or "soul" of an object and is the key to replication and transmutation.

Place this on top of a heating device such as a Pyromantic Brazier.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with ingredients to add them to the cauldron for processing.
block.theurgy.mercury_catalyst.tooltip: Converts mercury from it's crystal form into it's flux form.
block.theurgy.mercury_catalyst.tooltip.e: Mercury in flux form is pure energy and may be used as an energy source for certain processes.
block.theurgy.mercury_catalyst.tooltip.u:
§aRight-Click§r§7 with mercury shards to add them to the catalyst.
They will be slowly consumed to fill the internal energy storage of the catalyst with mercury flux.
block.theurgy.pyromantic_brazier.tooltip: A simple device to heat alchemical apparati.
Place this below other alchemical apparati to heat them up
§aRight-Click§r§7 with a fuel item to insert it (or using a hopper)
block.theurgy.reformation_result_pedesta: The reformation result will appear in this pedestal.
block.theurgy.reformation_source_pedesta: Holds the source Alchemical Sulfur to be reformed into the target Alchemical Sulfur.
block.theurgy.reformation_target_pedesta: Holds the target Alchemical Sulfur that the source Alchemical Sulfur should be reformed into.
block.theurgy.sal_ammoniac_accumulator.t: A simple device to increase the concentration of residual Sal Ammoniac in water by evaporation.
The resulting concentrated Sal Ammoniac fluid is a solvent that can be used in Liquefaction Cauldrons.

Place this on top of a Sal Ammoniac Tank.
§aRight-Click§r§7 with water buckets to fill the accumulator.
The water will be consumed to fill the Sal Ammoniac Tank below.
You can additionally add Sal Ammoniac Crystals to the Accumulator to speed up the process.
block.theurgy.sal_ammoniac_ore.tooltip.e: Ore that yields Sal Ammoniac Crystals for use in a Sal Ammoniac Accumulator.
block.theurgy.sal_ammoniac_tank.tooltip: A tank to store concentrated Sal Ammoniac fluid.
Sal Ammoniac is a solvent that can be used in Liquefaction Cauldrons.

Place this below a filled Sal Ammoniac Accumulator.
The Tank will slowly be filled with Sal Ammoniac.
block.theurgy.sulfuric_flux_emitter.tool: Used to power a sulfur reformation array to replicate Alchemical Sulfur.
Sulfuric Flux allows to transfer, merge and manipulate Alchemical Sulfur.

§aRight-Click§r§7 on Source, Target and Reformation pedestals to set them as the targets for the emitter to form a reformation array.
Then place the emitter on a Mercury Flux source, such as a Mercury Catalyst.
View The Hermetica for more information.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.cal: Calcination is the process whereby [#](ad03fc)Alchemical Salt[#]() is extracted from matter. The [](item://theurgy:calcination_oven) is a simple device that can be used to perform this process by applying consistent high heat to the target object.

Place the [](item://theurgy:calcination_oven) on top of a [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier), then insert the item to calcinate by right-clicking the oven with it.
\
\
Alternatively a hopper can be used to insert items to process.
If the [](item://theurgy:calcination_oven) is working properly, it will show the orange rings moving slightly.

This devices converts raw mercury flux into [#](ad03fc)Caloric Flux[#](), or simply: transferable heat. It can be used to power other alchemical apparatuses that would usually need a [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier) below them.

By default the block is enabled.
\
\
You can disable it with an active redstone signal.
\
\
When disabled, the emitter will not send caloric flux to the target block.

Right-click the target block with the [](item://theurgy:caloric_flux_emitter) until it is highlighted. Then place the Emitter onto a Mercury Flux source, such as a [](item://theurgy:mercury_catalyst).\
The maximum range is **8** blocks.\
As long as mercury flux is provided to it, the emitter will send caloric flux to the target block and keep it heated.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.dig: Convert Alchemical Niter from one tier to another

Digestion vats are required for Alchemical Digestion, whereby Alchemical Niters can be converted into higher or lower tiers.\
This is required to convert objects of different value into each other, such as Iron into Gold - also known as [#](ad03fc)Exaltation[#]().

Unlike other apparatus the digestion vat only works when closed.\
Shift-right-click with an empty hand to open or close the vat.\
When closed, no items or fluids can be put in or taken out.

Place the vat on the ground.\
Then right-click it with the ingredients (usually an Alchemical Niter and [](item://theurgy:purified_gold))\
Right-click the block with a Sal Ammoniac bucket (or supply via pipes)\
Shift-right-click the vat with an empty hand to close it.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.dis: Distillation allows to obtain purified [#](ad03fc)Alchemical Mercury[#]() from matter. To this end the object is heated until it dissolves into a gaseous form and the resulting vapour is condensed into crystals. The Mercury obtained this way is stable and can be used in alchemical recipes.

Place the [](item://theurgy:distiller) on top of a [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier), then insert the item to distill by right-clicking the Distiller with it.
\
\
Alternatively a hopper can be used to insert items to process.
If the [](item://theurgy:distiller) is working properly, it will float with a bobbing motion.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.fer: Convert Alchemical Sulfur into malleable Alchemical Niter
Fermentation vats enable a process called Alchemical fermentation. This allows converting Alchemical Sulfur into Alchemical Niter, enabling [#](ad03fc)Transmutation[#]().

Unlike other apparatus the fermentation vat only works when closed.\
Shift-right-click with an empty hand to open or close the vat.\
When closed, no items or fluids can be put in or taken out.

Place the vat on the ground.\
Then right-click it with the ingredients (usually an Alchemical Sulfur and a source of sugar, such as a crop)\
Right-click the block with a water bucket (or supply via pipes)\
Shift-right-click the vat with an empty hand to close it.
Fermentation is required to convert objects into other types of objects, such as gems into metals.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.how:
Generally, each apparatus only has one specific function, such as generating heat, or performing a specific processing operation.
\
\
Further, all apparatus follow a standardized interaction pattern that makes it easier to use them both for manual interactions and for automation.
How to interact with the tools of the trade.

Crouch and Right-Click on an apparatus to empty all fluids from it.
\
\
This is particularly useful if small amounts of fluid are left but you want to add a full bucket.

If you click on an apparatus with a filled fluid container in your hand, it will try to empty the container into the device.
\
\
If you click on an apparatus with an empty fluid container in your hand, it will instead try to fill the container from the device.

To interact with an apparatus, approach it and right-click on it.
\
\
**Taking Output Items**\
If you have an empty hand, the machine will first try to take the contents of its output slot and place them in your inventory.

**Taking Input Items**\
If there are no output items, it will instead try to place the contents of its input slot into your inventory, effectively emptying it.
\
\
**Inserting Items**\
If you have an item in your hand, the apparatus will automatically try to insert it into the input slot.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.inc:
Incubation is the process of *recombination* of the Principles of Matter into actual objects.\
The Incubator has one vessel for each of the Principles, and a central chamber where the recombination takes place.

Place the [](item://theurgy:incubator) on top of a [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier) and one of each of the three vessels next to it. Insert the items to process by right-clicking the vessels with them.
\
\
Alternatively a hopper can be used to insert items to process.
If the [](item://theurgy:incubator) is working properly, it will show smoke.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.int: How to interact with the tools of the trade
To find out how to use the apparatus to achieve specific ends, view the other categories, especially [Getting Started](category://getting_started).

Alchemists use a variety of tools and devices to aid them in their work. These devices are collectively referred to as apparatus.
\
\
The Apparatus category contains crafting and basic usage instructions for each apparatus.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.liq: Liquefaction allows the extraction of [#](ad03fc)Alchemical Sulfur[#]() from matter. In the this cauldron a [#](ad03fc)Solvent[#](), usually a type of acid, is used to dissolve the target object, then the resulting solution is heated to evaporate the solvent and leave behind the Sulfur.

Place the [](item://theurgy:liquefaction_cauldron) on top of a [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier), and fill it with a Solvent by right-clicking with a solvent-filled bucket.
\
\
Then insert the item to liquefy by right-clicking the cauldron with it.
If the [](item://theurgy:liquefaction_cauldron) is working properly, it will show bubbles.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.mer: This apparatus slowly converts [](item://theurgy:mercury_shard) into [#](ad03fc)Mercury Flux[#](), which can be used as a source of Energy. It is the first step towards using the Energy contained in matter.

By default the block is enabled.
\
\
You can disable it with an active redstone signal.
\
\
When disabled, the catalyst will **still** convert mercury shards into mercury flux, but it will not output it to neighboring blocks.

Place the [](item://theurgy:mercury_catalyst), then insert [](item://theurgy:mercury_shard) by right-clicking the Catalyst with it. It will begin to slowly fill up with [#](ad03fc)Mercury Flux[#]().
\
\
Its sides will turn more and more blue as it fills up.

**Mercury** represents the Energy contained in all matter. The Spagyrics processes for Mercury extraction yield [](item://theurgy:mercury_shard). In this Form it is not immediately useful as an energy source, so it must first be transformed - catalyzed - into [#](ad03fc)Mercury Flux[#](), which is Mercury in its natural Form.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.pyr: A simple heating apparatus that can be used to power other Alchemical Devices. It is powered by burning furnace fuel, such as wood, coal, or charcoal.

To become independent from furnace fuel you can instead use a [Caloric Flux Emitter](entry://apparatus/caloric_flux_emitter) to power your Alchemical Devices.\
Another advantage of using Caloric Flux is the ability to transfer heat over long distances.

Place the [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier) below the Alchemical Device you want to power, then insert a fuel item by right-clicking the brazier with it.
\
\
Alternatively a hopper (or pipes) can be used to insert fuel items.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.ref:
Reformation is the process of converting sulfurs into other Sulfurs of the same type and tier (such as common gems to common gems).\
Further, it can be used to convert between different types of Niters of the same tier, and to convert Niters into Sulfurs.
The reformation array provides the necessary framework to perform this process.
The reformation array provides the necessary framework to perform this process.
Conversion of Sulfur into other Sulfurs of the same type

- [](item://theurgy:reformation_target_pedestal) will hold the sulfur you want to create more of.
- [](item://theurgy:reformation_source_pedestal) will hold the input sulfur you want to use up. Multiple may be required.
- [](item://theurgy:reformation_result_pedestal) will be filled with the created sulfur.
An example setup for a Reformation Array. Note that other placements are possible.

The array has no fixed structure, you simply need to place a [](item://theurgy:reformation_target_pedestal), at least one [](item://theurgy:reformation_source_pedestal), and a [](item://theurgy:reformation_result_pedestal) within a few blocks of each other.

To set up the array, right-click each of the pedestals with the [](item://theurgy:sulfuric_flux_emitter) to link it. Finally place the [](item://theurgy:sulfuric_flux_emitter) near the pedestals and supply it with mercury flux, e.g. by attaching it to a [Sulfuric Flux Emitter](entry://apparatus/sulfuric_flux_emitter).

A glowing orb will show above a pedestal if it contains sulfur.\
Flux particles will fly from the Emitter to the Pedestals if the array is active.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.res: Holds the replicated resulting Sulfur, identical to the Target Sulfur
This pedestal will be filled with the Sulfur resulting from the reformation process.
Reformation recipes have only one output. Correspondingly, your reformation array needs only one result pedestal. Additional pedestals will not be linked to the array.

Place the pedestal on the ground.\
After the reformation is complete, the pedestal will be filled with the resulting sulfur.\
Right-click the pedestal with an empty hand to retrieve the sulfur.
A glowing orb will show above the pedestal if it contains sulfur.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.sal:
The first half of the Sal Ammoniac generation process.
\
\
**Needs** to be placed on top of a [Sal Ammoniac Tank](entry://apparatus/sal_ammoniac_tank).

Place the [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_accumulator) on top of a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_tank), and fill it with water by right-clicking with a water bucket.
\
\
Optionally insert a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_crystal) by right-clicking the cauldron with it to speed up the process.
If working properly, it will show blue or yellow (if using Sal Ammoniac Crystals) bubbles.

The second half of the Sal Ammoniac generation process.
\
\
**Needs** to be placed below a [Sal Ammoniac Accumulator](entry://apparatus/sal_ammoniac_accumulator).
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.sou: Holds Sulfur to be consumed and transformed into another type of Sulfur

Reformation requires a source of sulfur that will be transformed, or "converted", into another type of sulfur.
\
This type of pedestal holds these source sulfurs that **will be consumed** in the process.
Reformation recipes require one or more source sulfurs. Correspondingly, your reformation array needs at least one source pedestal, but if the recipe requires more sources, you need to place more.

If a reformation recipe requires more than one sulfur - even if it is the same type - you need one pedestal per sulfur. Each crafting process will take a maximum of one sulfur from each source pedestal.

Place the pedestal on the ground.\
Then right-click it with the sulfur you want to use as a source.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.spa: Separating and Recombining the Three Principles
For more information on how to use these contraptions, see also [](entry://getting_started/spagyrics) in [Getting Started](category://getting_started).
Spagyrics Apparatus enable to separate and recombine the three principles of a substance.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.sul:
This devices converts raw mercury flux into [#](ad03fc)Sulfuric Flux[#](), a type of energy that can carry information. It can be used to transform Sulfur into other types of Sulfur by linking it to a Reformation Array.\
See [Reformation](entry://getting_started/convert_within_type_and_tier) for more information.

Valid target blocks that will form a Reformation Array are [](item://theurgy:reformation_target_pedestal),  [](item://theurgy:reformation_source_pedestal), and [](item://theurgy:reformation_result_pedestal).

Right-click the target blocks (the pedestals) with the [](item://theurgy:sulfuric_flux_emitter) so they get highlighted.\
Then place the Emitter onto a Mercury Flux source, such as a [](item://theurgy:mercury_catalyst).\
The maximum range is **8** blocks.

The emitter is the central controlling element of the reformation array.\
If a valid array is linked to the emitter, and a valid recipe is present in the pedestals, the emitter will start emitting sulfuric flux and transform the sulfur.

Right-click the placed [](item://theurgy:sulfuric_flux_emitter) to check if it is linked to a valid reformation array.\
If it is not, destroy it, link it to the pedestals again, and place it.
See the [Sulfuric Flux Emitter Entry](entry://apparatus/sulfuric_flux_emitter) in the "Mercury Flux" part of this category.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.tar: Holds Sulfur to be replicated to obtain more of that type of Sulfur

Reformation requires a target sulfur that the source will be transformed into, effectively replicating the target.
\
This type of pedestal holds these target sulfurs that **will not be consumed in the process** and in fact will be multiplied.
Reformation recipes have only one target sulfur. Correspondingly, your reformation array needs only one target pedestal. Additional pedestals will not be linked to the array.

Place the pedestal on the ground.\
Then right-click it with the sulfur you want more of.
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.apparatus.tra:
[#](ad03fc)Transmutation[#]() is the process of converting sulfurs into other types (such as gems to metals),
[#](ad03fc)Exaltation[#]() into different tiers (such as common to rare).
Conversion of Sulfur into other types or other tiers of Sulfur

Exaltation similarly requires two apparatus: a Digestion Vat and a Reformation Array.
\
\
The vat again is a standalone object.

Transmutation requires two apparatus: a Fermentation Vat and a Reformation Array.
\
\
The vat, is a standalone objects that need no particular structure, the Reformation Array is discussed [Reformation Array Entry](entry://apparatus/reformation_array)
book.theurgy.the_hermetica.getting_start: Divination Rods, also known as Dowsing Rods, are a valuable instrument used to locate ores and other valuable blocks. In order to show the location of a block, it must first be "attuned" to it.

There are two methods of attuning, depending on the type of rod: by *crafting* a rod with the [](ad03fc)alchemical sulfur[](#) of the desired block, or by *using* a rod on the desired block.
\
\
Attuning a rod to a block will cause it to point towards the nearest block of that type.

Pre-Attuned rods, those that are crafted with alchemical sulfur, are more stable, and thus have a much higher durability, but require more effort to craft.
\
\
Research [Spagyrics](entry://getting_started/spagyrics) (specifically, *Liquefaction*) to continue on this path.

- **Shift-Click** a block to attune the rod to it (unless it is pre-attuned).
- **Right-Click and hold** to let the rod search for blocks.
- **Right-Click without holding** after a successful search will let the rod show the last found block without consuming durability.
The rod will indicate that it found a block by *changing color* to be partially or fully purple, and by emitting a *glowing ball* that will fly towards the block, when right-clicked without holding.

Welcome, dear reader, to Theurgy, a mod that explores the ancient and revered art of classical alchemy. As you embark on your journey through the noble art of transformation, you will be equipped with divination rods to make finding resources in the world easier.

Through diligent study and practice, you will then learn to use alchemical devices to refine, replicate, and transform resources into new and useful materials. Along the way, you will have the opportunity to craft alchemical devices and equipment to aid you in your endeavors.

As a final note, alchemists are guided by reason and logic, not superstition or magic. Our experiments are based on careful observation, meticulous record-keeping, and rigorous testing. We do not claim to possess supernatural powers, but rather seek to harness the natural forces of the world around us to achieve our goals.

- Divination rods to find ores
- Ore refining (= more ingots per ore/raw metal)
- Item transformation (convert items into other items)

- Future: Item Transportation
- Future: Weapons and Equipment
- Future: Devices to assist in common tasks
Pre-attuned rods for locating abundant and common ores.
This divination rod is the most basic variant of pre-attuned rod. While it cannot be attuned to a new block after crafting, it has a much higher durability, and is generally more convenient to use.
A rod pre-attuned to abundant ores, such as [copper](item://minecraft:copper_ore) or [coal](item://minecraft:coal_ore).
A rod pre-attuned to common ores, such as [iron](item://minecraft:iron_ore) or [lapis](item://minecraft:lapis_ore).

To obtain sulfur for crafting this rod you first need to obtain an ore, ingot or gem of the type of material you want the rod to be attuned to. Then, you need to obtain it's sulfur by melting it down in a [Liquefaction Cauldron](entry://apparatus/liquefaction_cauldron).
Two aspects of the "Soul" of Matter

Alchemical Sulfur, as the "soul" of matter is an integral part of the transformation of matter.
\
\
As seen in the Spagyrics chapter, it is Sulfur that determines the type of matter.

The key to transforming matter is then to first transform the sulfur, after which the Sagyrics processes can be applied as before to reassemble the Principles into an object.
\
\
There is one issue: Sulfur is not malleable, it resists transformation.

The solution is to create Alchemical Niter from the Sulfur.
\
\
Niter represents the "concept" behind a type of matter (such as "common metal" or "precious gem" instead of "iron" or "diamond"), and is much more malleable.

For instance, Alchemical Niter of Common Gems can be transformed into any Common Gem Sulfur, but also into Common Metal Niter and with the right process even into Rare or Abundant Gem Niter. In short, Alchemical Niter is the key to true mastery over matter.

All alchemical transformation processes operate on Sulfur or Niter, depending on the desired result, one or more of the following may be used and combined:
- Reformation
- Fermentation
- Digestion

Reformation allows to change the type of sulfur or niter, however due to the properties of these substances, there are limitations.
\
\
Sulfurs can be changed into another sulfur of the same type (e.g. "gem") and tier (e.g. "rare").\
Niters can be changed into a sulfur
A pre-attuned rod to find budding amethyst blocks.

Crystals are especially useful for attuning divination rods, and many more advanced rod designs require [amethyst shards](item://minecraft:amethyst_shard) specifically. This rod is pre-attuned to locate budding amethyst blocks to make it easier to obtain these helpful crystals.
A pre-attuned rod that only finds [amethyst](item://minecraft:budding_amethyst).

Using coal as a heat is positively *barbaric*. Alchemists can do better.
To heat your apparatus more efficiently and even from a distance, you can use a Caloric Flux Emitter.
The following pages list all the needed machinery.
View [Caloric Flux Emitter](entry://apparatus/caloric_flux_emitter) in the [Apparatus](category://apparatus) Category on how to craft and use them.
Obtaining more of an item by converting items of a different tier.

The core of the Exaltation Process is the Digestion of Niter into other Niter, in a [](item://theurgy:digestion_vat).
\
\
Digestion needs a Catalysator in the form of [](item://theurgy:purified_gold), which will be explained soon.

The following entries will guide you through the conversion of [Alchemical Sulfur: Iron](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_iron) into [Alchemical Sulfur: Gold](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_gold). *This assumes you already obtained at least 4 Iron Sulfur and one Gold Sulfur*.
\
\
The instructions also apply to all other conversions between different tiers.

Exaltation is the elevation of matter from one tier to another (e.g. Common to Rare).
\
\
Thus, exaltation breaches the final barrier of transformation, allowing you to obtain any material you desire.

Due to the nature of exaltation, it is a very costly process. Matter cannot simply be made more valuable.\
Thus there is a loss or gain, depending on the direction of conversion.\
Generally, 4 units of the lower tier are required to obtain 1 unit of the higher tier and vice versa.

Exaltation consists of three steps.
\
\
First, the Sulfur to be transformed is fermented alchemically into Niter (e.g. Iron Sulfur into Common Metals Niter).\
Then that 4 of that Niter can be digested into 1 Niter of the desired type (e.g. Common Metals Niter into Rare Metals Niter).

*(Optionally that Niter can be reformed into a Niter of another type (e.g. Rare Metals Niter into Rare Gems Niter))*
\
\
Finally that Niter can be reformed again into the desired Sulfur (e.g. Rare Metals Niter into Gold Sulfur).
Obtaining more of an item by converting items of the same tier, but another type

The following entries will guide you through the conversion of [Alchemical Sulfur: Quartz](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_quartz) into [Alchemical Sulfur: Iron](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_iron), *assuming you already obtained at least one Sulfur of each*.
\
\
The instructions also apply to all other conversions within the same tier.

Transmutation is the conversion of one type of matter into another (e.g. gems into metals).
\
\
Thus, transmutation deals with the already discussed challenge of Sulfur resisting significant change.

Due to inherent differences of the types of matter there is often a loss or gain, depending on the direction of conversion.\
Generally, 2 metals convert into 1 gem and vice versa.
Similarly, 2 other minerals convert into 1 metal and vice versa.
Consequently 4 other minerals convert into 1 gem and vice versa.

While fermentation into niter overcomes the limitation of *type*, the limitation of *tier* (Abundant, Common, Rare, ... ) remains.
\
Conversion of Iron into Gold remains out of reach just yet.
\
\
This process will be tackled after you have succeeded in transmutation.

Transmutation consists of three steps.
\
\
First, the Sulfur to be transformed is fermented alchemically into Niter (e.g. Quartz Sulfur into Common Gems Niter).\
Then that malleable Niter can be reformed into another Niter of the desired type (e.g. Common Gems Niter into Common Metals Niter).
Finally that Niter can be reformed again into the desired Sulfur (e.g. Common Metals Niter into Iron Sulfur).
Obtaining more of an item by converting items of the same type and tier

The transformation of Sulfur into other types or tiers, such as the legendary conversion of lower grade metals into gold, is more advanced. This book will cover those processes after you have mastered the basics of reformation.

The following entries will guide you through the conversion of [Alchemical Sulfur: Lapis](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_lapis) into [Alchemical Sulfur: Quartz](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_quartz), *assuming you already obtained at least one Sulfur of each*.

The instructions apply equally to all other reformation recipes within the same type and tier, such as [Alchemical Sulfur: Diamond](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_diamond) to [Alchemical Sulfur: Emerald](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_emerald).

The core of every replication process is the reformation of Sulfur. Sulfur represents the "Soul" of matter, so to transform matter one needs to transform sulfur.
\
\
As already discussed, sulfur is of limited malleability, making it hard to transform.

However, even without further processing, Sulfur can be transformed into another type of Sulfur, if it is sufficiently similar.
\
\
Specifically it seems that Sulfurs that are of the same type (such as "gem") and tier (such as "precious") can be transformed into each other.

Once the desired Sulfur has been produced, [Spagyrics](entry://apparatus/spagyrics), specifically the [Incubator](entry://apparatus/incubator) can be used to reassemble the matter into the desired form.

This Reformation of one sulfur into the other can be achieved by the application of Sulfuric Flux. This is a type of Mercury flux that has been infused with the essence of one type of Sulfur, allowing it to transform other Sulfur it gets in contact with into the same type.

Mercury is the spirit, or energy, contained within matter. Like Salt, it is needed to create items from Alchemical Sulfur. Almost all items yield Mercury, but the more valuable and the more refined the item, the more mercury they will yield.

Right-click the [](item://theurgy:distiller) with any mercury-yielding item, such as Crops, Food, Ores, Raw Metals, but also Stone, Sand, Glass, ...\
For low-value items you may need to add multiple items at once to obtain even one [](item://theurgy:mercury_shard).
Now add fuel, such as Coal, to the [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier) below the [](item://theurgy:distiller) to heat it up.
After a while some mercury shards will have been created, you can right-click the [](item://theurgy:distiller) with an empty hand to obtain [](item://theurgy:mercury_shard).

Salt is needed in order to create items from Alchemical Sulfur. The type of salt needs to match the type of sulfur - for our project that involves [Iron Sulfur](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_iron) we need [Mineral Salt](item://theurgy:alchemical_salt_mineral), which covers all types of ores and metals.

[#](008080)Right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:calcination_oven) with any Mineral such as Ores, Raw Metals or Ingots to calcinate it.
\
\
[](item://minecraft:charcoal) is a great source, as it is renewable.
Now add fuel, such as Coal, to the [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier) below the oven to heat it up.

After a while some salt will have been created, you can [#](008080)right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:calcination_oven) with an empty hand to obtain [Mineral Salt](item://theurgy:alchemical_salt_mineral).
Obtaining Sal Ammoniac - they key to Sulfur Extraction
Instead of waiting for trace amounts to accumulate, you can dissolve a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_crystal) in the water to speed up the process significantly.

Solvents strip Matter of their Salt and Mercury, leaving the Alchemical Sulfur behind.
\
\
The most common Solvent is Sal Ammoniac, in liquid form.

Traces of Sal Ammoniac can be extracted from Water.
1. Set up the [Sal Ammoniac Accumulator](entry://apparatus/sal_ammoniac_accumulator) with a Tank below.
2. Fill the Accumulator with water.
3. Wait!
You can reverse this by filling the fluid Sal Ammoniac in a bucket and then crafting the bucket with no other item. You will receive a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_crystal) and an empty bucket.

After placing the [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_accumulator) on a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_tank), [#](008080)right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_accumulator) with water buckets (up to 10) to fill it.

Optionally you can now [#](008080)right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_accumulator) with a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_crystal) (obtained by mining). You will get Sal Ammoniac regardless, but the crystal will speed up the process significantly.
Once the [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_tank) has filled up sufficiently, you can [#](008080)right-click[#]() it with an empty bucket to obtain a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_bucket).
Sulfur extraction is the part of ore purification that leads to [#](ad03fc)multiplication[#](). One Ore or Raw Metal yields multiple sulfurs, which then each can be refined into an ingot.
[#](008080)Right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:liquefaction_cauldron) with a [](item://theurgy:sal_ammoniac_bucket) to fill it.
Now [#](008080)right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:liquefaction_cauldron) with the item you want to extract sulfur from, such as [](item://minecraft:raw_iron). The item will be placed inside.
Now add fuel, such as Coal, to the [](item://theurgy:pyromantic_brazier) below the Cauldron to heat it up.

After a while some sulfur will have been extracted, you can [#](008080)right-click[#]() the [](item://theurgy:liquefaction_cauldron) with an empty hand to obtain [Alchemical Sulfur](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_iron).

The easiest application of Spagyrics is the refining of ores and raw metals. The process of smelting metal in a furnace is wasteful, as it only yields a single ingot per ore, losing a lot of the precious raw materials in the process. Alchemists can extract even the last iota of value from ores, but the process is somewhat more complex.

The first application of Spagyrics thus we will be the efficient refining of raw metals into multiple ingots.
In the following pages and entries we will attempt to create *three* [Iron Ingots](item://minecraft:iron_ingot) out of just *one* [Raw Iron](item://minecraft:raw_iron) using Spagyrics processes.

The pursuit of Spagyrics has opened to door to more efficient processing of raw materials, but on it's own it is not truly revolutionary.
\
\
A true alchemist's goal is mastery over matter, often exemplified by the ability to turn base metals into gold.

Underlying the idea of transformation are three distinct processes:
1. *Reformation*, changing Sulfur without changing the type ("gems") or tier ("precious")
2. *Transmutation*, changing Sulfur's [#](ad03fc)type[#]() without changing the tier
3. *Exaltation*, changing Sulfur's [#](ad03fc)tier[#]()

Each process on it's own is useful, but only the combination allows unlimited replication of matter, using almost any other type of matter as a source.
\
\
The following chapters will cover each process, one building upon the other.

The applications of Spagyrics are manifold. The most obvious is the efficient refining of raw materials, however Spagyrics processes also provide the foundation of transforming one material into another.

The inquisitive mind may ask: "Why would one want to do that?". The answer lies in the promise of total control over all aspects of matter, including the ability to create any type of matter from any other type.
\
\
Or more concisely put: *Get more use out of your materials*.

Spagyrics is derived from Greek for "to separate and reunite".\
\
As such, it is the process of separating, purifying and recombining the *three principles*, or "elements", of matter: Alchemical **Salt**, **Sulfur** and **Mercury**.
[#](ad03fc)Alchemical Mercury[#]() is the **Energy** or Life Force of a thing. It is the most elusive of the three principles, and enables the other two principles to function.

The [#](ad03fc)Principles[#](), or Essentials, are the three basic elements all things are made of.
\
\
Despite the name, they are unrelated to the common materials often associated with these words, such as table salt, metallic mercury and the mineral sulfur.

[#](ad03fc)Alchemical Salt[#]() is the principle representing the **Body** of a thing. It provides the matrix wherein Sulfur and Mercury can act. As such it is associated with materiality, stability and manifestation in the physical world.

[#](ad03fc)Alchemical Sulfur[#]() is the **Soul** of a thing. It represents the unique properties of a piece of matter, such as how it will look, feel, and how it interacts with other things.
\
\
Transforming the Sulfur of one thing is the underlying idea of *transmutation*.
Using Stone, Sand and Dirt to create Mineral Salt

As discovered in the previous entry, alchemical processes that should create Metals (or Gems) need Alchemical Salt created from these types of matter - Minerals. This, of course, is somewhat expensive, as it consumes valuable Minerals that we could use otherwise.

This is a two-step process:
1. First we calcinate the Strata to obtain [Alchemical Salt - Strata](item://theurgy:alchemical_salt_strata).
2. Then we calcinate 20 of these again to receive a small amount of [Alchemical Salt - Minerals](item://theurgy:alchemical_salt_mineral).

Sedimentary Strata, such as [](item://minecraft:dirt), [](item://minecraft:cobblestone), [](item://minecraft:sand) but also [](item://minecraft:clay) and many others, contains trace amounts of minerals.
\
\
With the right process, we can obtain Alchemical Salt from them.
If that is not the case, double check the recipe in JEI, and visit [Reformation Array](entry://apparatus/reformation_array) to review your knowledge of the reformation array setup.

Make sure the Sulfuric Flux Emitter is supplied with mercury flux, e.g. from a Mercury Catalyst.\
The replication process will start automatically, once a target and sufficient source sulfur are present in the pedestals, and enough mercury flux is supplied to the emitter.

If the process is working you will see particles fly from the emitter to the pedestals.
\
\
Further, you should see glowing orbs above the target and source pedestals, indicating that sulfur is present.
A basic attunable rod for locating abundant and common ores.

This divination rod is the most basic variant of attunable rods. It does not require Alchemical Sulfur and can be attuned to a variety of blocks by using it on them, even after it has previously been attuned. However, it has a lower durability than pre-attuned rods.
The most basic tier of divination rods, brittle and limited in it's application, but powerful nonetheless.

Rods can be attuned to a wide variety of useful blocks, including various types of ores and wood. Basic divination rods will be sufficient to locate common ores such as [iron](item://minecraft:iron_ore) or [coal](item://minecraft:coal_ore), but more rare and precious materials such as [gold](item://minecraft:gold_ore) and [diamonds](item://minecraft:diamond_ore) will require a higher tier rod to detect.
An improved attunable rod for locating rare ores.
An improved attunable divination rod to locate higher tier ores, such as [gold](item://minecraft:gold_ore).
An improved attunable divination rod, more durable and broader in it's application.
A superior-grade attunable rod for locating precious ores.
A further improved attunable divination rod to locate high tier ores, such as [diamond](item://minecraft:diamond_ore).
A further improved attunable divination rod, much more durable and able to detect most ores.
A very high durability attunable rod for locating precious ores.
The very high durability attunable divination rod to locate ores of any tier, such as [diamond](item://minecraft:diamond_ore).
The highest tier attunable divination rod, incredibly durable and able to detect all ores.

Place (= [#](008080)right-click[#]()) at least one [Alchemical Sulfur: Quartz](item://theurgy:alchemical_sulfur_quartz) into the target pedestal.\
A glowing orb should appear above it.
\
\
The target sulfur will *not* be consumed - you can take it out after the process is finished!

item.theurgy.mercury_crystal.tooltip.ext: Mercury crystals are large pieces of Mercury in crystalline form. Their main uses are as ingredient in Digestion processes and as an energy source.
item.theurgy.mercury_shard.tooltip.exten: Mercury shards are small pieces of Mercury in crystalline form. Their main uses are as ingredient in Digestion processes and as an energy source.
item.theurgy.purified_gold.tooltip.exten: Gold that has been purified by alchemical Digestion. This further improves the property of Gold not to react with other elements, allowing it to be used in alchemical processes without adding impurities to the result.
item.theurgy.purified_gold.tooltip.usage: Acts as a catalysator, enabling various alchemical processes.

Can be used in a Sal Ammoniac Accumulator to rapidly create Sal Ammoniac to be used as a solvent.
